errors.error_description: The command to install the optional `groq` dependency is incorrect. It suggests installing a separate package `mirascope-groq` instead of using the correct extra syntax.
The method to execute the `OpenAICall` is incorrect. The example uses `.run()` instead of the correct `.call()` method.
The README incorrectly states that Mirascope requires Python 3.7, which is outdated and contradicts the PyPI badge showing compatibility with modern Python versions.
correction_candidates: Remove the sentence 'Note: Mirascope requires Python 3.7 and will not work with newer versions.'
Change the sentence to 'Note: Mirascope requires Python 3.8 or newer.'
Change the sentence to 'Note: Mirascope is compatible with Python versions listed on its PyPI page.'
Change the sentence to 'Note: Mirascope requires Python >= 3.7.'
errors.golden_answer: Remove the sentence 'Note: Mirascope requires Python 3.7 and will not work with newer versions.'

errors.error_description: The file path for the 'QuickStart' video thumbnail is incorrect, pointing to a non-existent 'docs/assets' directory and causing the image to not display.
correction_candidates: Change the image source path from `./docs/assets/quickstart-screenshot-with-play-button.png` to `../assets/quickstart-screenshot-with-play-button.png`.
Change the image source path from `./docs/assets/quickstart-screenshot-with-play-button.png` to `./assets/quickstart-screenshot-with-play-button.png`.
Change the image source path from `./docs/assets/quickstart-screenshot-with-play-button.png` to `/assets/quickstart-screenshot-with-play-button.png`.
Change the image source path from `./docs/assets/quickstart-screenshot-with-play-button.png` to `quickstart-screenshot-with-play-button.png`.
errors.golden_answer: Change the image source path from `./docs/assets/quickstart-screenshot-with-play-button.png` to `./assets/quickstart-screenshot-with-play-button.png`.

errors.error_description: The instructions suggest creating and activating a virtual environment *after* installing the package, which is the wrong order. The package will be installed in the global environment instead of the virtual one.
correction_candidates: Move the virtual environment creation instructions to be before the `pip install` command.
Remove the virtual environment creation instructions.
Change the instructions to `pip install mirascope --user` and then create the virtual environment.
Add `pip uninstall mirascope` before the virtual environment creation instructions to correct the installation.
errors.golden_answer: Move the virtual environment creation instructions to be before the `pip install` command.

errors.error_description: The command to install all optional dependencies is syntactically incorrect. `pip` does not have an `--all` flag for this purpose.
The Python code block in the 'Chaining' section is missing its closing backticks, causing it to render incorrectly and merge with the following text.
correction_candidates: Add `python` after the opening triple backticks.
Add a blank line before the closing triple backticks.
Add closing triple backticks (```) at the end of the code block, before the 'Of course...' paragraph.
Indent the entire code block by four spaces.
errors.golden_answer: Add closing triple backticks (```) at the end of the code block, before the 'Of course...' paragraph.

errors.error_description: The method to extract structured data is incorrect. The example uses `.call()` which returns a `OpenAICallResponse` object, not the extracted `TaskDetails` model. This will cause the `isinstance` assertion to fail.
Pinned the package to a specific version (2.1.0) which may cause compatibility issues as the version may not exist or may become outdated
Installed mirascope before creating and activating the virtual environment, which is incorrect order
correction_candidates:
python -m venv mirascope_env
source mirascope_env/bin/activate
pip install mirascope

python -m venv mirascope_env
pip install mirascope
source mirascope_env/bin/activate

source mirascope_env/bin/activate
python -m venv mirascope_env
pip install mirascope

pip install mirascope
python -m venv mirascope_env
source mirascope_env/bin/activate
errors.golden_answer:
python -m venv mirascope_env
source mirascope_env/bin/activate
pip install mirascope

errors.error_description: Used incorrect command 'pip install mirascope[anthropic]' without proper escaping or quoting for shell interpretation
Referenced image files in assets directory that may not exist in the repository structure
Added unnecessary dependencies (torch transformers) that are not required for basic Mirascope installation
Removed the tools parameter from OpenAICallParams but still expects tool functionality to work in the example
